name: The Final Take
description: Relive dark footage recorded from the perspective of multiple characters in this unique first person horror.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Dual core from Intel or AMD at 2.8 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: nVidia 320M or higher, or Radeon 7000 or higher, or Intel HD 3000 Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: First impressions as I started the game:    Why is the main protagonist walking around with a camera as she's going to    get a job at a hospital    ?   Why doesn't she leave when she sees the first monster? Or, hell, when she sees the hospital is outright creepy and abandoned?   Why does the male protagonist look at a camera through a camera?   Whilst I don't think the voice acting is bad, it is out of place.   Pros :   Cool first chapter, but... (see cons)   Interesting overall ambiance   2$   Cons :   Too short (Half an hour)   Too easy   Pretty lazy, one enemy per level, and they will follow you everywhere   Poor sound effect variation   Poor man's Slender Man (but much less challenging)   Story

The Final Take  is a very short survival horror game that borrows elements from the found footage film genre. It follows the story of a young girl that arrives at an empty, abandoned hospital for a job interview. There she finds a television set and VCR which then continues the story through a flashback.   While the overall presentation is inspired by horror flicks such as  The Blair Witch Project  and  V/H/S , the VCR tracking effect is very overwhelming with a light tint barely lighting the gameplays darkness. With grain and static scrolling through your screen, it's all very rough on the eyes and at times disorienting. I personally own hundreds of VHS tapes, and none look this bad. Also, considering the gameplay asks players to run around open environments looking for pictures while a wailing ghost follows, it all becomes very cheap, very fast.  For about two dollars  The Final Take  isn't too much of a loss. It has it's own achievements and trading cards, but other than that, it is simply another indie dud.

This game has potential, but is not worth your time.  I finished chapter 1 in around 5-10 minutes and this is all the game had to offer me:  -very cheap jumpscares -annoying crawling monster with bad AI chasing me(very slowly, wasn't even a challenge evading it) -almost no sound effects (all I could hear was my running and THAT didn't even work at points!) -cliche hospital setting, I cannot tell you how many indie horrors use this  Steer clear of this one, unless you want the generic crappy indie horror experience, except your paying for this one. Don't take it as I'm saying 'all indie horror games are bad', this one is just a perfect example of what not to do when making one.  It's a shame, I truly love horror games, and wanted to love this one, but was able to make my decision within 10 minutes. Quite sad and disappointing...

Love the setup... looks and sounds creepy enough... it's nice to play it late at night in dark.  Remings of all the found footage movies and even a little bit of escape rooms experiences.   It will suck you in and you'll probably finish it in one go... it's not the longest one, but for less then $2 it's definitely worth every single penny!

-starts game  -enters hospital  -walks around and figures stuff out  -goes downstairs gets key   -see ghost  -'♥♥♥♥ this ♥♥♥♥ i'm out'  -goes up 2 floors  -sees crawler  -'♥♥♥♥ NO'  -runs away to basement  -gets cornered and gets breathed on to death  10/10 would get breathed on again
12 mins is enough to see how big of a turd this game is.

The reviews were quite mixed when I looked at this game the first time but, this game is pretty friggin scary. Although the graphics arent the best it still manages to be terrifying. Low res games are much creepier for me (for some reason) and this game has scared me ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, and im only on chap. 2. If you enjoy low res horror games, this one is deffinetly a download.
The Final Take is a very nice horror game. This game is short but can scare you. Many times my heart was beating harder. The price is low and has trading cards! I recommend!
